definition: Marat (name)/Jean-Paul Marat (1743-1793), Swiss scientist and physician
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
Guatemala/see also 瓜地馬拉|瓜地马拉[Gua1 di4 ma3 la1]
Málaga, Spain/Malaga city in Iranian East Azerbaijan

pinyin: Xi3 ma3 la1 ya3 shan1 mai4

sentences.english: Mountain half marathon in Tumbler Ridge, British Columbia, Canada.
sentences.chinese: 山一半在杯的马拉松隆起，不列颠哥伦比亚，加拿大。

sentences.english: Will the Himalaya Mountains, home to the world's highest peaks, continue to push up into the sky in future?
sentences.chinese: 拥有世界最高峰的喜马拉雅山还将继续“长高”吗？

sentences.english: Malabo is one of the schools that is affected annually.
sentences.chinese: 马拉博就是其中一所每年都被影响的学校。

sentences.english: If I dont know the answer, then go ask Malah.
sentences.chinese: 如果我不知道答案，那就去找马拉。

sentences.english: The main accumulation stages are late Hercynian and Himalayan.
sentences.chinese: 其主成藏期为海西晚期和喜马拉雅晚期。

sentences.english: Kumaratunga highly complimented the stance of China.
sentences.chinese: 库马拉通加夫人对中方的这一立场给予高度评价。

sentences.english: Tyler never ate in restaurants, and Marla wasn't wrinkled.
sentences.chinese: 泰勒从来不在餐馆里吃饭，而马拉也没有长皱纹。

sentences.english: A word once spoken cannot be taken back, even with a team of four horses.
sentences.chinese: 一句话说出了口，就是套上四匹马拉的车也难追上。

sentences.english: Sunday's marathon was the eighth for the 27-year-old, who has been running for more than a dozen years.
sentences.chinese: 上周日的马拉松比赛是这位27岁的女性第八次参赛。
喜马拉雅山脉农家，卡林，不丹，1989。

sentences.english: He romped home in the marathon race.
sentences.chinese: 他在马拉松赛跑中轻而易举地获胜。

sentences.english: Lions attack a buffalo on the Masai Mara in Kenya
sentences.chinese: 肯尼亚马塞马拉，狮子袭击一只水牛。

sentences.english: Let's say, your brother just ran a marathon.
sentences.chinese: 假设你的哥哥参加了一场马拉松赛跑。

sentences.english: "Marathoners run until they fall down, " she said.
sentences.chinese: “马拉松运动员就是跑到倒下为止，”她说。

sentences.english: They also brought with them the horse-drawn chariot and introduced the composite bow into the Egyptian arsenal.
sentences.chinese: 他们将马拉的运输车和综合弓，带入了埃及的武库。

sentences.english: In the jungles of 1)Guatemala, in Tikal, stands a temple.
sentences.chinese: 在危地马拉丛林深处的蒂卡尔，矗立着一座神庙。

definition: to rein in/to compel/to force/to carve/to engrave/(literary) to command/to lead/bridle/(physics) abbr. for 勒克斯[le4 ke4 si1], lux
Ur (Sumerian city c. 4500 BC in modern Iraq)
Dole (name)/Bob Dole (1923-), US Republican politician, Kansas senator 1969-1996
Werther, opera by Jules Massenet/Werther, German masculine given name
headman (of primitive people)/tribal chief/used as translation for foreign leaders, e.g. Indian Rajah or Arab Sheik or Emir
